News

Online catalogue and accounts not available 13-14 June 2018

Written by Leon Paternoster · Published Jun 13, 2018

We're performing essential maintenance on our website overnight 13-14 June.

Suffolk Libraries marks the increasing popularity of eLibrary services

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 6, 2018

Over half a million items have now been borrowed from our eLibrary. In 2017/18, our customers borrowed nearly 107,000 eBooks and 29,000 eAudiobooks from OverDrive and BorrowBox, downloaded 24,000 eMagazines from RBdigital, and 52,000 songs from Freegal. They also streamed 109,000 songs from Freegal.

Bungay Library to temporarily close for refurbishment in July

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 5, 2018

Bungay Library will be closed from Tuesday 10 - Wednesday 18 July for refurbishment and redecoration. It will reopen at the usual time of 9am on Thursday 19 July.

Suffolk Libraries to host Once Upon a Festival events in June

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 4, 2018

We're teaming up with Theatre Royal Bury St Edmunds this month to host five performances as part of the ‘Once Upon A Festival’ children’s arts festival.

Kesgrave residents to benefit from longer library opening hours

Written by James Powell · Published May 31, 2018

Suffolk Libraries is increasing opening hours at Kesgrave by six and a half hours a week to meet local demand.

Beccles Library to temporarily close for refurbishment in June

Written by James Powell · Published May 18, 2018

Beccles Library will be closing for one week in June for refurbishment and improvements.

Thurston student wins 23rd Book Mastermind

Written by James Powell · Published May 9, 2018

Katy Shaw from Thurston Community College is the winner of Suffolk Libraries’ Book Mastermind competition 2018.

Suffolk Libraries to celebrate Elmer Day

Written by James Powell · Published May 3, 2018

Several libraries in Suffolk are holding colourful events to celebrate Elmer the Patchwork Elephant this month.

Clare and Needham Market libraries' opening hours to change from June

Written by James Powell · Published May 3, 2018

Following a recent consultation with customers Clare Library and Needham Market Library are changing their opening hours from Monday 5 June.

Slaughter in Southwold crime writers' festival returns for a sixth year

Written by James Powell · Published Apr 25, 2018

Southwold Library has launched the programme for Slaughter in Southwold 2018. A number of top crime writers will be giving talks at the established crime writers’ festival on Saturday 16 and Sunday 17 June.
